about_the_game:
Have you ever been on a subway? Perhaps you feel a bit scared when the roaring train is swallowed by the pitch-black tunnels? Or perhaps you are soothed by this liminal space where time stops, where there is no day or night?..

If you stay in the underground after hours, you might hear the sound of a train when the last one has already passed. But there is always just the sound. There is no train to be seen. Some superstitious metro workers say it is an ill omen, and try not to listen to the sounds at night. But not everyone believes that it’s real. Do you?

WATCH OUT, THE DOORS ARE CLOSING is a magical realist visual novel, a funny and sad tale about ghosts of a Ukrainian subway, and an exploration of the meaning of life where there seems to be no meaning. Play as Nastya, a musician who makes her living playing on the subway. People have different opinions of her: many ignore her, some like her music, and some others go out of their way to insult her. One day, Nastya gets an opportunity to unlock the hidden powers of her talent as she meets the passengers on the ghost train.

In a rollercoaster of emotions and impressions, you will learn about three very different characters: their problems, their hopes, and where they’re headed. With her music and her charisma, Nastya can influence and change the fate of each, if she can only learn how to touch their heart strings. Perhaps she can also change her own fate. Choose wisely!

This is a demo version of a full game. As it is, the game features:
3 endings (1 of the three present in the DEMO version)
Charismatic and unforgettable characters
Unique setting of a Ukrainian subway
Bright and emotional sprites
Animated backgrounds
An original soundtrack, perfect for the mystical musical adventure
Unlockable audiovisual content in the gallery for your viewing and listening pleasure

WARNINGS:
Camera shaking effects
Bright colours
Suicide mentions
Violence mentions
All characters portrayed are fictional, and any similarity to real persons is entirely coincidental.

The team warns that the topic of this game is death. Right now, there is war going on in Ukraine, and a lot of us have more than enough reasons to want to hide from reality. We all need rest and distraction, it is normal. Please take care of yourselves.

Take a blanket.
Sit down in a comfortable chair.
Make some tea.
And memento mori.

content_descriptors.notes: The game features mentions of suicide, self-harm, and violence. It also has mild swearing and scenes with characters smoking.
